summary: The diff implements the vast majority of requirements well. All five core requirements (REQ-1 through REQ-5) are addressed with meaningful implementations. The primary gap is that the product placeholder image is referenced with a dimensional suffix filename rather than the plain filenames specified in REQ-5. Additionally, unauthenticated visitor product viewing is not fully functional since getProducts requires a principal. The profile tagline field (distinct from bio) is also absent as a separate field.

missing_requirements.requirement: Hero banner image must be loaded from frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-banner.png and default product placeholder from frontend/public/assets/generated/product-placeholder.png
missing_requirements.reason: The code references 'hero-banner.dim_1200x400.png' in ProfileHero.tsx and 'product-placeholder.dim_400x400.png' in ProductCard.tsx, not the plain filenames specified in REQ-5.

missing_requirements.requirement: Unauthenticated users see a fully rendered read-only profile and product showcase
missing_requirements.reason: In App.tsx, products are only fetched when principal is available (authenticated). Unauthenticated visitors have no principal, so useGetProducts returns nothing and the product showcase will be empty for visitors rather than showing the owner's products.

missing_requirements.requirement: Profile page includes a tagline field distinct from bio as specified in requirements
missing_requirements.reason: The UserProfile type in backend/main.mo and all frontend components include displayName, bio, profilePhotoUrl, and socialHandle but no separate tagline field. The build request lists bio/tagline as distinct profile fields.

hallucinated_features.description: ProfileSetupModal is non-dismissable, blocking all interaction until the authenticated user creates a profile
hallucinated_features.reason: The build request does not specify a mandatory non-dismissable profile setup modal. It only requires the profile to be editable by the owner. The modal prevents escape key and outside click dismissal, which is behavior beyond what was specified.
